com.jbion.utils.xml.serialization.serializers

Class ArraySerializer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jbion.utils.xml.serialization.serializers.Serializer<T[]>
      • com.jbion.utils.xml.serialization.serializers.ArraySerializer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the components of the serialized arrays managed by this serializer.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DateArraySerializer, DurationArraySerializer

    public abstract class ArraySerializer<T>
extends Serializer<T[]>
    An XML serializer for arrays of objects from the type variable's class. The class of the components of such arrays must have a corresponding SimpleSerializer.
    Author:
    Joffrey Bion
    See Also:
    Serializer, SimpleSerializer

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArraySerializer

        public ArraySerializer(Serializer<T> componentSerializer)
        Creates an ArraySerializer for arrays of objects that can be serialized by componentSerializer.
        Parameters:
        componentSerializer - The Serializer that handles the component class of the arrays handled by this ArraySerializer.

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        public String[] serialize(Object[] values)
                   throws ClassCastException
        Returns a serialized version of the specified array.
        Parameters:
        values - The array of objects to serialize.
        Returns:
        A String array representing the serialized values of the components of this array obtained via SimpleSerializer.serialize(Object). This method returns null if values is null.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - If the class of the components of the specified array is not the class handled by this ArraySerializer.

      • deserialize

        public T[] deserialize(String[] serializedValues)
                throws ParseException
        Retrieves an array of objects corresponding to the specified array of String.
        Parameters:
        serializedValues - The array of values to assign to this parameter, in the serialized String form.
        Returns:
        an array of objects obtained from each String via SimpleSerializer.deserialize(String).
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the objects' class does not match the class handled by this ArraySerializer.
